#	RESEARCH AND SCIENTIFIC IMPACT



M. Mascini has published more than 70 papers (60% as corresponding author) on international scientific journals (peer-reviewed) with an average Impact Factor of 4.

He actively participates in national and international scientific meetings with more than 100 posters or oral presentations.

M. Mascini research area is focused on the development of screening methods for fast and real time detection of analytes important for food, environmental and health analysis. The research interests are on new methods to develop bio-inspired and bio-mimetic systems in analytical application using molecular modeling and multivariate analysis.

# PUBBLICATION SUM_STAT

```{r include=FALSE}
library(bibliometrix)
```


```{r bib_a, echo=TRUE}
M <- convert2df(file = "MMCVscopus.bib" , dbsource = "scopus", format = "bibtex")
results <- biblioAnalysis(M, sep = ";")
S <- summary(object = results, k = 10, pause = FALSE)
plot(x = results, k = 10, pause = FALSE)

```

# keyword co-occurrences network

```{r bib_b, echo=TRUE}
ID <- cocMatrix(M, Field = "ID", sep = ";")
sort(Matrix::colSums(ID), decreasing = TRUE)[1:20]
AB <- cocMatrix(M, Field = "AB", sep = " ")
sort(Matrix::colSums(AB), decreasing = TRUE)[1:100]

```

#  Network Plot

```{r bib_c, echo=TRUE}
NetMatrix <- biblioNetwork(M, analysis = "co-occurrences", network = "keywords", sep = ";")

net=networkPlot(NetMatrix, normalize="association", weighted=T, n = 30, Title = "Keyword Co-occurrences", type = "fruchterman", size=T,edgesize = 5,labelsize=0.7)

```
